thread.title: Hilarious video shows new mother high on pain medication
thread.title_full: Hilarious video shows new mother high on pain medication

title: Hilarious video shows new mother high on pain medication
text: Share this article Share 'Her first reaction was to go for a walk but I couldn't let that happen. This went on for at least ten minutes before she fell asleep again.' At one point he tells his drowsy wife: 'You gave birth to Clay over there.' She responds angrily: 'No! I gave birth to Jackson,' referring to their 15-month-old son. Shocked: Still high on pain medication, new mother Tisha, left, looks stunned as husband James, right, tells her about the arrival of their son Clay, just hours after she gave birth Confused: The mother-of-two asked whether her husband was her mother or her brother Revelation: She asked whether she had given birth by pushing the baby out of her bellybutton As she works through a confused train of thought, Tisha closes her eyes and asks her husband: 'Can you see me?,' before questioning whether he is her mother. When she is told she 'pushed out a kid', the new mother asks: 'Out of my bellybutton?' Her husband then explains how she gave birth and she lifts her hospital gown to check he is telling the truth. Clear head: After the medication wore off, Tisha clearly remembered giving birth to baby Clay. Pictured the new mother with husband James and their newborn son in hospital Proud: Newborn baby Clay taking a nap with 15-month-old brother Jackson, pictured behind Mr Heffron said once she woke up from her 'drug induced hibernation' she was 'fully cogent. 'Straight away she remembered Clay and the whole birth process,' he added. 'That was a relief.' James said: 'Once Tisha had woken up from her drug induced hibernation she was fully cogent.
